items.sentence: Thank you very much for lending me $500 when I was having difficulty making ends meet.
Before olives can be eaten, they must be soaked in lye, which must then be rinsed off.
The police are now looking for the person responsible for dumping garbage in the park.
I prefer staying home when it's cold because I can stay warm and wear whatever I want.
As I entered the hospital, I noticed many people in neck braces, slings, and bandages.
I left home later than usual, but I was still able to catch the train I usually catch.
I washed my blankets and hung them up outside. It'll take a few hours for them to dry.
No news is good news. If you haven't heard from your son it's because he's doing well.
The more often you see a word when reading, the easier it is to remember its spelling.
The best way to learn a foreign language is to go live in a country where it's spoken.
